it's too valuable
ooh, this is cool.

I think it might be better to add the client logic [here](https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/client/framework/attach-thread.js#24) though. The rationale is this:

1. it's nice to have the logic next to where we highlight the tool. It also gets us the check for relevance [1]
2. we can pause before the debugger is open. It's rare, but possible... think `debugger` in the console.
3. this way the entire feature is in MC

[1]
```js
  if (packet.why.type === "debuggerStatement" ||
       packet.why.type === "breakpoint" ||
       packet.why.type === "exception") {
}
```
I've got the `browser_dbg-returnvalues.js` mochitest working again. Going to start looking at the failure.
This change brings the time it takes to pause `perf.html` from 7s to 163ms. I kinda feel bad bragging about this because 7s is so large.

How did we get these savings? We deferred mapping the scopes until after we've saved the set the pause data. We're also not blocking on that data as well. To be fair, when we landed expression mapping we knew that we were incurring a big perf hit for bundled files, but felt it was worth it because expression mapping was a big feature that we had been working on for over a month.
@jasonLaster, this should be good to go, although I haven't manually QA'd it, yet.

Upgraded to 0.53.0. Going farther than that will take some more work. I'll do that sometime, and may also come back and cleanup some of the types.
@juliandescottes Sir, let me know which combination would be better. I will try modifying it. 
@pradeepgangwar I think we should keep the keys white-ish. So let's use another color for dark theme. 

Can probably do something similar to what the accordion does:

https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/04918304796bd5912ba6958c4b48519f16cef1c7/src/components/shared/Accordion.css#L1-L7
thanks for the comments jason! I also thought it would be nice to have it all in one place, but here is why i have the front end call "clientPaused" explicitly:

1) by having it in the client, it is easier to pass the localized "pause reason" message back to the server, instead of having to redo how we do localization in order to synchronize it between server and client. It would save us work later on.

2) the server pauses before the client, and there is a disconnect between the debugger ui being available for debugging, and the pause overlay being shown. I found this frustrating as a user, though it may be alleviated later on if we improve performance
This will probably have to be calculated based off of the codemirror width, do you need any help with that?
this looks good
I think this is not fully accurate. In the example above line 47 is actually out of scope. With this code it is considered in scope, so when you hover over `todo` in line 47 you see `undefined` in the preview, which is not good. It's not defined since it's out of scope.
here's where we calculate the gutter width now:

https://github.com/devtools-html/devtools-core/blob/master/packages/devtools-source-editor/src/utils.js#L40-L52

we could use it like this 

```js
import { SourceEditorUtils  } from "devtools-source-editor";
const { resizeBreakpointGutter } = SourceEditorUtils
```

Hi @svitlana-galianova !

I like this change... it's a subtle way to see where you are in a larger project. If you don't mind, I think you could make a couple small changes to take advantage of the `getURL` utility already in the project.

The `getURL` utility would be added [here](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/components/PrimaryPanes/SourcesTree.js#L27-L36). The function lives in the utils/sources-tree folder if you want to check it out, but you should only need to call it like the other utils.

By doing that, you should be able to to do something like `const isDebugeeDomain = getURL(this.props.debuggeeUrl)` [here](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/components/PrimaryPanes/SourcesTree.js#L217), which will then make your comparison for the class to `item.name` much simpler.

For the CSS, I would recommend moving it to the Sources.css since this is really more about the tree than the svg. I did the exact same thing yesterday for PR I am working on :)

Does that make sense? Keep up the great work!

> I think this is not fully accurate. In the example above line 47 is actually out of scope. With this code it is considered in scope, so when you hover over todo in line 47 you see undefined in the preview, which is not good. It's not defined since it's out of scope.

I would say Line 47 is in scope and `todo` is not initialized and not visible from outside. When entering `toggleAll` function, that function scope is on. For some not-yet-initialized variable, `undefined` for them should be expected.

See another case:
1. go to [todomvc-react](http://todomvc.com/examples/react/#/active)
2. add a bp in TodoModel.js#32 (the 1st line inside `app.TodoModel.prototype.addTodo `)
3. Add one todo in todomvc-react
4. Observe the moment we stop at the bp in TodoModel.js#32
We can see the variables inside that function scope are observable and no-yet-initialized variables are undefined.
![oodqdou8nh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5627487/31850210-01f5b712-b681-11e7-8944-567b0cfe701c.gif)

Consider another case
```js
function doA(n) {
   let result = doSomeJob({ id: n + 1  }); // Set a bp A here
   return result;
}
function doB(n) {
   let result = doSomeJob( // Set a bp B here
      { id: n + 1  }
   );
   return result;
}
```
`doA` and `doB` are totally the same just different in line breaks. When stopping at the bp A, `{ id: n + 1 }` is in scope but undefined because it is not yet initialized. What about stopping at the bp B? The situation should be the same for the bp B.

Chrome is doing the same thing and just not displaying it
![ylxfo9wkct](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5627487/31850211-0a56ab64-b681-11e7-8927-41b96ee53d9f.gif)


@jasonLaster Updated to use the 2nd approach. Please look thank you
@jasonLaster and @amitzur
Elaborate why go updating contains.js to fix this issue.
This is a fix without affecting the total architecture plus improving contains.js.

For the whole issue, there are 2 aspects to consider:
1. Currently, `containsPosition` may face the condition without the column criterion but it didn't handle that so the issue happened. Maybe we could fix this issue using another approach. However, `containsPosition` still should be improved in case the similar issue happens again. As a result, no matter what, we should improve `containsPosition` anyway. Go for it to fix this issue is more reasonable.

2. What if try to fix this issue from the *in-scope* angle? The thing will get complicated. The current architecture takes *out-of-scope* angle, which is to remove those not in scope given by `containsPosition`. There are some options for the *in-scope* way, for instances: 
    - Touch `getInScopeLines`[1] to consider the case with the same line but out-of-scope column. This approach is to *re-translate* the job of `getInScopeLines`, which is like saying `getInScopeLines` only cares the same line and column doesn't matter. To some degree that's acceptable(but maybe still debatable). However we now are facing a problem that we don't have the bp info.
      [1] https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/085c871b1dd6b84956525cca1b08ed0bac8b4ace/src/selectors/linesInScope.js#L22

    - Do *in-scope* from the ground up. OK, then we have to touch actions and reducers [2] and more  architecture, which is too risky and requires deeper and broader analysis.
       [2] https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=OUT_OF_SCOPE_LOCATIONS&type=

    - Add fix in other places, I can foresee some side-effect or impact to the architecture.





I was working on the issue #4369 from 5 days ago but forgot to leave the message (sorry for causing the double effort). I will suggest another approach for the issue #4369 . Please see the detailed explanation: https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/pull/4381#issuecomment-338382838
In case of double effort, this issue now is being handled and under discussion in #4381 and #4428 .
The issue relates to the computed and uncomputed MemberExpressions. it's looking at `obj[key]` (computed) as `obj.key` (uncomputed)
working on this

By the way to any reviewers or curious folks!

If you pull down the changes to play with. Here is what is available.

* searching for text "somefile" still searches available sources
* searching with `@` proceeding your query will search the functions in the current file (this is the behavior from the symbol modal before) Example (`@getDamage`, `@gtdmg`)
* searching with `#` proceeding your query will search the variables in the current file (we had this before but disabled.) Example (`#playerSize`, `#plysz`)
* entering `:<line>(:<column>)` will jump to the location in the current file. Example (`:32`, `:65:12`)
* searching for a source and adding a `:<line>(:column)` after it will jump to the location in the selected source. Example (`todos:25:13`, `mpfile:12`)
Is this still a thing? Seems to be behaving as expected now:
![klo9rpqulp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23530054/31982910-1d69c060-b95b-11e7-98c1-9f0e16ce291b.gif)

lol



> hmm, @miketaylr I'm not seeing the error:

Oops. One detail I left out, @jasonLaster:

You need a Firefox for Android UA string to get the bug to reproduce, because otherwise you won't hit the `dispatchEvent` code path that gets a `console.error`. So you have to add a custom device in RDM using "Mozilla/5.0 (Android 8.0; Mobile; rv:58.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/58.0" (or whatever).

(As an aside... I still think it's weird we don't send a Gecko UA in RDM by default, but whatever).
(and just verified this still reproduces in the latest nightly)
Here's the source: https://github.com/yurydelendik/old-man-sandbox/blob/master/babel-parse/package.json

Another oddity:  flip back and forth between the two sources and empty conditional breakpoint elements multiply:

<img width="856" alt="conditionals" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46655/32032382-7a509e18-b9cc-11e7-978f-87ed5368ba64.png">

Should be fixed with https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/pull/4483
This is kind of interesting.

- `getScopes` (utils/scopes.js) is trying to build the list of scopes to display in the panel. It would like to recognize the scope of the currently executing frame, to display it specially&mdash;in particular, to call `getSpecialVariables`, which shows the return value if present. Unfortunately, this call never happens: `pauseInfo.frame.scope` is `undefined`, so it has no idea which scope is the currently executing frame's. Intriguingly, `pauseInfo.frame.scope` *is* set; its value is just `undefined`.
- I looked at the pause packets we're getting from the server; one is shown below. Note that the `frame` property has type `"call"`, which [the protocol documentation][proto] says means it should have an `environment` property. It does not.
- As a sanity check, I made sure the client is indeed expecting an environment property there. Indeed:
  - [paused (client/firefox/events.js)][paused] receives each pause packet, and passes it to...
  - [createPause (client/firefox/create.js)][createPause], which passes the frame to...
  - [createFrame (client/firefox/create.js)][createFrame], which [checks `frame.environment`][check].
 
[proto]: http://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/docs/backend/protocol.md#function-call-frames
[paused]: https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/client/firefox/events.js#L38-L54
[createPause]: https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/client/firefox/create.js#L51-L62
[check]: https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/client/firefox/create.js#L32

## The pause packet

Here's the pause packet we got [edit: had wrong packet, but the story is the same]:
```
{
  "from": "server1.conn47.child1/context27",
  "type": "paused",
  "actor": "server1.conn47.child1/pause8465",
  "frame": {
    "actor": "server1.conn47.child1/frame5656",
    "type": "call",
    "callee": {
      "type": "object",
      "actor": "server1.conn47.child1/pausedobj8466",
      "class": "Function",
      "extensible": true,
      "frozen": false,
      "sealed": false,
      "name": "return_something",
      "displayName": "return_something",
      "parameterNames": [
        "x"
      ],
      "location": {
        "url": "http://localhost:8000/integration/examples/doc-return-values.html",
        "line": 8
      }
    },
    "this": {
      "type": "object",
      "actor": "server1.conn47.child1/pausedobj8467",
      "class": "Window",
      "extensible": true,
      "frozen": false,
      "sealed": false,
      "ownPropertyLength": 767,
      "preview": {
        "kind": "ObjectWithURL",
        "url": "http://localhost:8000/integration/examples/doc-return-values.html"
      }
    },
    "arguments": [
      2
    ],
    "where": {
      "source": {
        "actor": "server1.conn47.child1/source29",
        "generatedUrl": null,
        "url": "http://localhost:8000/integration/examples/doc-return-values.html",
        "isBlackBoxed": false,
        "isPrettyPrinted": false,
        "isSourceMapped": false,
        "sourceMapURL": null,
        "introductionUrl": null,
        "introductionType": null
      },
      "line": 11,
      "column": 4
    }
  },
  "poppedFrames": [],
  "why": {
    "type": "resumeLimit",
    "frameFinished": {
      "return": 2
    }
  }
}
```

<img width="935" alt="screen shot 2017-10-26 at 11 23 52 am" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/254562/32061643-307ce9da-ba40-11e7-9082-7ebee76e9293.png">

yeah - lets build the simple thing first for styling the matched chars... making them blue :) or something like that. I think what we did for project search is pretty close... The basic algorithm for finding the chars for a query like "foo" is to take the match result string and split it up into matching and not-matching spans. so if the result is` "af/my/o/o.js",` => `"a", "f","/my/","o","/","o",".js"`

@jasonLaster 
The spec for this is:

```
jumpLabel = {
  isOriginal ? false : !isPrettyTabOpen
}
```
If the file opened is pretty printed(i.e. isOriginal), u will see "jump to generated location" always
Else if its generated, "Jump to Original Location" will be disabled if "!isPrettyTabOpen". As if its not pretty printed, you cannot jump to the original location

`
const blackBoxMenuItem = {
    disabled: isOriginal
  };
`
"Blackbox source" and "Reveal in tree" are also disabled for pretty printed (i.e, original source)

It looks like these warnings are from a known issue in React v15.6 when using `import * as React from 'react';`
https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/10583

The React team decided not to fix since these warnings go away when switch to React v16.0
So, the above is the case in only one instance `src/components/shared/Modal.js`

The rest of the errors are from `React.createClass` and `React.PropTypes` being used in the 
```
devtools-launchpad
devtools-splitter
devtools-components
```
packages, which are part of https://github.com/devtools-html/devtools-core. I could make a PR over there.
yeah had little time but am still on it. ( we are releasing major version of one of our applications shortly )

@jasonLaster reverted the changes as per your request 😃 
Yes. Seems to be fixed in master. I can see this html:

`<div class="CodeMirror-linewidget" cm-ignore-events="true"><div class="conditional-breakpoint-panel">`

cm-ignore-events will ignore right click inside the conditional breakpoint panel

We can close this issue.

I think exact types with covariant properties will be even better.

```js
type MyAction = {|
  +id: string,
  +value: number,
|}
```

This will reflect that our Redux states are immutable. https://flow.org/en/docs/react/redux/#toc-typing-redux-state-immutability
Yeah
We landed a util for [`isReactComponent`](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/src/workers/parser/frameworks.js#L3).

We can now easily check :)

and add it here:

```diff
diff --git a/src/components/Editor/Tabs.js b/src/components/Editor/Tabs.js
index 50aba30..927b8a2 100644
--- a/src/components/Editor/Tabs.js
+++ b/src/components/Editor/Tabs.js
@@ -451,6 +451,10 @@ class SourceTabs extends PureComponent<Props, State> {
   getSourceAnnotation(source) {
     const sourceObj = source.toJS();
 
+    if (isReactComponent) {
+      return <img className="react" />;
+    }
+
     if (isPretty(sourceObj)) {
       return <img className="prettyPrint" />;
     }
```
